definitions.definition: A crowd ; a throng ; a multitude or great number of people.
A pile or mass ; a collection of things laid in a body, or thrown together so as to form an elevation.
examples: a heap of earth; a heap of stones

definitions.definition: A great number or large quantity of things.
A data structure consisting of trees in which each node is greater than all its children .

examples: You should move these structures from the stack to the heap to avoid a potential stack overflow.
My first car was an old heap .

main_definition: A crowd ; a throng ; a multitude or great number of people.
secondary_definitions: A pile or mass ; a collection of things laid in a body, or thrown together so as to form an elevation.
A great number or large quantity of things.
( computing ) A data structure consisting of trees in which each node is greater than all its children .
( computing ) Memory that is dynamically allocated.
( colloquial ) A dilapidated place or vehicle .
( colloquial ) A lot , a large amount
